speaker: GUARD
line: Last wall... Pour it on!

speaker: WHALEY
line: Man, this little piece of wood ain't gonna hold no twister! We need to dig a hole, you know what I'm saying?

speaker: GUARD
line: Whaley!

speaker: WHALEY
line: A big hole. The man ought to be givin' us shovels. This whole damn place is going to blow away. Why even bother? Yo, boy, back me up, here!

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Shut up and hold it still.

speaker: WHALEY
line: I know you ain't talkin' to me! You a big man, huh? Is that right? Charley potatoes. Big-ass criminal. You a bad man? You a bitch, that's all you are. You ain't got no money. You ain't got nothing. I'll hold it still.

speaker: WHALEY
line: Is that still enough for ya?! Huh?!

speaker: GUARD
line: Put down the hammer, Rawls! Rawls!

speaker: FELLOWES
line: Messed up old Whaley, did he?

speaker: GUARD
line: Messed him up good.

speaker: FELLOWES
line: Now what'd you go and do that for?

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Man pissed me off, Boss.

speaker: FELLOWES
line: Who the hell doesn't? Box him.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: You can't put me in that box, Boss. The... the storm's coming.

speaker: FELLOWES
line: Should have thought of that before you messed up old Whaley.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Well, to hell with Whaley. You can't put me in that box! Boss! You can't put me in there! You can't put me in that box! You can't do it! You're going to kill me, Boss! Boss!

speaker: GUARD
line: You know they're saying tornado touchdowns all over the county.

speaker: FELLOWES
line: I can't be responsible for Acts of God.

speaker: GUARD
line: Sorry, Rawls.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Let me out! Let me out!! Heeeelp!! Somebody!! Somebody help me, please!

speaker: GUARD
line: Oh, hell.

speaker: GUARD
line: Hello, sir?

speaker: GUARD
line: Oh, my god...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Should we arrest David Copperfield?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, we should... but not for this. Now this is, uh, Raybert Fellowes superintendent of Road Farm Six, Mississippi Department of Corrections. One of his guards found him in his office. Not a drop of blood in the place.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, maybe he was killed elsewhere.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I don't think so. Whoever did it took 40 minutes to do it in the middle of a tornado. What do you make of that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know. It's, uh... it's not a simple bisection. There's a considerable amount of his abdomen missing. I mean, it almost looks like a burning but it's too localized. Maybe an industrial acid.

speaker: MULDER
line: There's, um... no acid found in his office.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh. Spontaneous human combustion.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully...!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, isn't that where you're going with this?

speaker: MULDER
line: Dear Diary: Today my heart leapt when Agent Scully suggested spontaneous human combustion.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, there are one or two somewhat well-documented cases.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, shut up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay. What do you make of this?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't have a theory. But I know of someone who does.

speaker: GUARD
line: Hell, yes, Pinker Rawls who did it. Though you got me as to how.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And who is Pinker Rawls?

speaker: MULDER
line: An inmate.

speaker: GUARD
line: Mean son of a bitch.

speaker: MULDER
line: Rawls was the prisoner who supposedly died in the tornado that preceded superintendent Fellowes's murder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you're saying that a ghost did this?

speaker: GUARD
line: I'm not putting the word to it. That's up to y'all. All I know is that Rawls hated the Captain. Captain locked him in the box when the storm hit and Rawls didn't want to be locked in the box and when we found the box biggest piece was about yay big... … three miles from here. Now, this whole place was locked and boarded up tight. No man got in here. That's all I'm saying.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So we're looking for a dead man?

speaker: MULDER
line: I disagree. I think this Pinker Rawls is still very much alive. You know, they never found his body.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay. Well, at the risk of further ridicule, Mulder, what if this wasn't a murder? I mean as I understand it, current theory on spontaneous human combustion is that climatic conditions play a large part. So, possibly a tornado may fit the bill. We've got lightning, um, static electricity at a high potential.

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't argue with that. But I do think it's murder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, then how did Rawls or whoever do this? How did he get in and out of a locked office and prop a body up against the inside of a door?

speaker: MULDER
line: Termites?

speaker: GUARD
line: This is all he had in his bunk area.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wilson Pinker Rawls, age 34. Eight years into 30 for robbing a wire office in Bay Saint Louis. The $90,000 he stole was never recovered.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, it's not in here. Hey. Look at this.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ouch.

speaker: SCULLY
line: His record dates to 1978. Mostly small-time. History of violence throughout.

speaker: MULDER
line: I wonder who she is.

speaker: WERTHER
line: Thanks, Cutie. Hey, you broke out the good stuff.

speaker: JUNE
line: Well, we're worth the good stuff.

speaker: WERTHER
line: Mmm.

speaker: JUNE
line: Hey, Robert?

speaker: WERTHER
line: Hmm?

speaker: JUNE
line: Can I show you something? I mean, just a little food for thought?

speaker: WERTHER
line: Wh... Oh. Wait, Sweetie. They're talking about the tornado.

speaker: NEWSCASTER
line: Take a look at this video just in. Hardest hit was a state prison farm outside the village of Stringer where two deaths are reported in the wake of the storm. A funnel cloud with winds topping 150 miles per hour tore through the isolated work camp passing within yards of a barracks filled with terrified inmates. Among the dead, Captain Raybert Fellowes, the farm's superintendent a 28-year veteran of the Department of Corrections. A second authorities say...

speaker: JUNE
line: Excuse me.

speaker: NEWSCASTER
line: ...whose job was to secure the prison...

speaker: WERTHER
line: You okay, June?

speaker: NEWSCASTER
line: ...from the oncoming storm. High winds apparently carried the man away. Though his body has not been found, Rawls is presumed dead. In other news …

speaker: BOBBY THE SECURITY GUARD
line: You got a gun pointed at you. Don't try to run.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: I ain't runnin'.

speaker: BOBBY THE SECURITY GUARD
line: Oh... Hey! Hey, that's store property. Take those off.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Oh... There's something so nice about putting on a brand-new pair of socks. I don't know what it is.

speaker: BOBBY THE SECURITY GUARD
line: I said, take those off, boy.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Mmm... Ooh! Oh... Oh, my. What you think? That's me, right? And room to grow in.

speaker: BOBBY THE SECURITY GUARD
line: You got an attitude, I'll say that.

speaker: BOBBY THE SECURITY GUARD
line: Get the hell up. Turn around. Hands behind the pole.

speaker: BOBBY THE SECURITY GUARD
line: This is Bobby in security. I've detained an intruder at the Val-U-Mart on Nine Mile Road and Route 60. … I don't know how the hell he got in here… Got him cuffed in the back.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that the guy?

speaker: BOBBY THE SECURITY GUARD
line: Yeah, could be. I guess. It was pretty dark.

speaker: MULDER
line: How'd he get away?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Whoever he was.

speaker: BOBBY THE SECURITY GUARD
line: You got me. The guy's like Houdini. Turned my back and he was gone. I had him right here.

speaker: MULDER
line: You had him handcuffed... here. Can I see your handcuffs?

speaker: MULDER
line: We have a last known address for Pinker Rawls?

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: What's up?

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Where is she? ago. You mad 'cause her and me shacked up? I'm sorry, buddy.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Bo, I want what's mine.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: You got nothing in there but your nine.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Bo, you're going to shoot me? Boo! Bleah! Are you gonna do something? Ha!

speaker: MULDER
line: This is Rawls's last known address. Security guard's car.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ugh! Ugh. Gesundheit.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my god.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Pistol in his hand, slide locked open, shell casings everywhere. I don't see any bullet holes anywhere, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't recognize him from his driver's license, do you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Bo Merkle. This is his house.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but Rawls used to live here and he's come back looking for something.

speaker: SCULLY
line: $90,000. The wire office robbery eight years ago. The money hasn't been recovered.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think he spent that in prison.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't think Mr. Merkle did either, judging by the decor.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe she knows. That's this house, isn't it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can run down the name.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, I bet Rawls is looking for her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, this is Special Agent Dana Scully with the FBI. There's been a murder here at 922 Washington Avenue in Jackson. I need crime scene support on-site as soon as possible. Thank you. Oh, and could you transfer me to the records division, please?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Got a name to go with the face. June Gurwitch. There's no current address, though and, uh, no record of her since 1996.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe she changed her name. Maybe she was afraid she'd end up like that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The state police have put out an APB on Rawls.

speaker: MULDER
line: You might warn them not to shoot to kill. He seems to find that annoying.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, Mulder, even if those were bullets...

speaker: MULDER
line: They are. It's just that their composition has been changed just like the handcuffs and just like the prison wall.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Even if these were bullets, there is no way that they could pass through Rawls in the way that you're describing-not, not without leaving him sprawled dead on the ground for us to find.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think they just went right through him, - whsssht - like his wrist went through the handcuffs and like he walked right through that prison wall.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He walks through solid objects?

speaker: MULDER
line: Changing their composition fundamentally-- making steel brittle, turning lead bullets into powder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And flesh into carbon.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know how else to explain what happened to that prison superintendent or to poor Mr. Merkle over there, who's got no face anymore.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But where's the science in all of this, Mulder? You're talking alchemy.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not saying that it can't be explained scientifically. Maybe it's the tornado. You suggested it yourself. Unusual climatic conditions... high electrical potential...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry I even brought it up.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, we both agree on who he's looking for?

speaker: SCULLY
line: June Gurwitch.

speaker: MULDER
line: And do we have any idea of how to find June Gurwitch?

speaker: SCULLY
line: She has a sister named Jackie, and I have the address.

speaker: JUNE
line: Hello.

speaker: JACKIE
line: Hey, it's me. Is this a good time?

speaker: JUNE
line: No, Jackie, it is never a good time.

speaker: JACKIE
line: Look, the Jackson City police just called me… Yeah. They're looking for you.

speaker: JUNE
line: What'd you tell them?

speaker: JACKIE
line: Nothing but they brought up Pinker and they wanted to know what he might want with you.

speaker: JUNE
line: Pinker's dead. I heard it on the news today.

speaker: JACKIE
line: Well, maybe you'd better call him... just in case he's not.

speaker: WERTHER
line: June?

speaker: JUNE
line: I got to go.

speaker: JACKIE
line: June?

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Hey, Jackie.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: That's not very friendly, Jackie.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Jackie...

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Tell me where she is.

speaker: JUNE
line: I'm not telling you anything.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jackie Gurwitch? FBI!

speaker: MULDER
line: Where'd he go?

speaker: JACKIE
line: He left.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Her son's spending the night at a friend's house and she's going to meet them there. She said that she didn't tell Rawls where her sister was. Mulder, she said that he walked right through the wall.

speaker: MULDER
line: Bo Merkle's car is parked down the street. That's how he got here. I don't know how he left.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe he left on foot or he stole another car.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why would he leave without getting the information he wanted?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, maybe he's still in the neighborhood. I think the, uh, local PD can search but we have to get going.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where to?

speaker: SCULLY
line: To Meridian. That's where June Gurwitch lives... or June Burdett as she's now called.

speaker: WERTHER
line: Yes?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agents Scully and Mulder with the FBI. We are looking for June Gurwitch, also known as June Burdett.

speaker: WERTHER
line: "also known as..." June. Look, what's this all about?

speaker: SCULLY
line: An escaped convict by the name of Wilson Pinker Rawls-- we believe that he may be pursuing Ms. Gurwitch with the intention of harming her.

speaker: WERTHER
line: "Gurwitch"? I don't understand.

speaker: MULDER
line: June?

speaker: JUNE
line: Pinker's alive, isn't he?

speaker: JUNE
line: Jackie? She and her son...?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They're fine.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who is Rawls to you?

speaker: JUNE
line: A mistake. The biggest one of many. We lived together. Are you sure you know who you're looking for? I remember one time this guy cuts Pinker off on the highway. I mean, just cut him off-you know, kind of thing that happens to everybody every day. He followed this guy for 62 miles right over the state line-- 62 miles-me pleading with him the whole way to stop. Follows the guy up to his house. The guy gets out of his car, smiling. He doesn't know what's coming to him. Pinker pulls a picket off a white picket fence and cracks that guy's skull open with it. He's not going to stop.

speaker: MULDER
line: What does Rawls want? The money? $90,000 from the Bay Saint Louis robbery?

speaker: JUNE
line: I didn't even know about that till they came to the door to arrest him, okay? I mean, Pinker was already in prison before I found that money.

speaker: JUNE
line: By accident.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you took it.

speaker: JUNE
line: Eventually, yeah. I thought about it for about a week or two.

speaker: MULDER
line: And where's the money now?

speaker: JUNE
line: Put a down payment on this place. Bought a couple of sofas... chintz curtains... PC for Robert.

speaker: JUNE
line: I just wanted another chance.

speaker: ROBERT WERTHER
line: Look, I have a job. I've got responsibilities. I can't just disappear like this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's best you both stay under 24-hour guard until Rawls is apprehended. It's for your protection.

speaker: ROBERT WERTHER
line: No, it's for her protection. Let's be clear here. This guy Rawls or whoever, he's not looking for me. She took his money.

speaker: JUNE
line: Robert, I'm sorry...

speaker: WERTHER
line: Excuse me. I've got my own place. I promise to stay the hell away from here, okay? How about it?

speaker: WERTHER
line: Look, I just want to get out of here, okay? I didn't break any laws.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Don't discuss this with anyone, Mr. Werther.

speaker: ROBERT WERTHER
line: I'm forgetting it ever happened.

speaker: MULDER
line: Give me your keys.

speaker: MULDER
line: Get her out of here. I want a guard on her at all times.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Rawls was in the trunk?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. And we took him right where he wanted to go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: You think he's trying to tell us something?

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, look at this. I'm assuming Rawls wrote this with his finger just like the other one. Look here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He stopped at the mirror.

speaker: MULDER
line: Or the mirror stopped him. What makes an object solid, Scully? I mean, what, what prevents one solid object from passing through another solid object, usually?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Electrostatic repulsion. Individual electrons repelling one another like magnets.

speaker: MULDER
line: Electrons. What if Rawls's ability somehow has to do electricity? What would preclude it or contain it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Resistance against electrical current. A good insulator like rubber, like glass.

speaker: MULDER
line: Exactly. Rawls couldn't pass through this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Say... say that your theory is correct- that he can walk through walls. Why go through all this effort over an old robbery score? It's $90,000-- he could get that anywhere, right?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's not about the money. It's never been about the money.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yet he turned this place upside down which means he was looking for something. And I think it has to do with this. It's a lien on unpaid hospital bills dating back to 1992 and the patient name is June Gurwitch. And this is an IC D-9 number-- a hospital diagnostic code. This particular one means...

speaker: MULDER
line: Pregnancy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Right. Specifically, c-section.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is seven years ago. That's just a few months after Rawls was sent to a prison farm.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh-huh. "I want what's mine." This man is looking for his child, Mulder.

speaker: NEWSCASTER
line: ...and will return in time to take part in meetings at the UN. a statewide manhunt is underway at this point as escaped convict Wilson Pinker Rawls-- a man previously thought to be a victim of Tuesday's storm-- continues to elude police. He is to be considered armed and extremely dangerous.

speaker: JUNE
line: I'd like to call my sister.

speaker: TROOPER COLLINS
line: Sorry, ma'am. No calls.

speaker: TROOPER COLLINS
line: This is a non-smoking room, ma'am.

speaker: ANOTHER TROOPER
line: Looks like Collins put up a fight. Guess it wasn't enough. I can't tell you what happened here-- how Rawls got in-- but he took the woman with him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where are they headed?

speaker: ANOTHER TROOPER
line: They stole a station wagon. Last seen headed south.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He has to intend for June to lead him to his child.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, we got to get there first.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, but where? We don't have a name or an address. I mean, June may not either, for that matter. If the child was … was adopted... I think our best bet is to go through state records but it's going to take some time.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm going to need some equipment. Special issue.

speaker: JUNE
line: Pinker, I apologize. Look, I'm really scared right now, okay? Talk to me. Please... please say something. Anything. Look, I'm sorry about the money-- your money. I shouldn't have taken it. It was wrong. I was wrong. Pinker, I can pay you back.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: What was it? What'd you have?

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: You dumb bitch. You don't even know what I'm talking about. What'd you have? Was it a boy or a girl?

speaker: JUNE
line: A boy... a boy.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: A boy … a boy... a boy. What's his name? You know his name, don't you?

speaker: JUNE
line: Trevor Andrew.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Trevor what?

speaker: JUNE
line: Trevor Andrew.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Trevor Andrew … Rawls. You never were going to tell me. I'd have gone to my grave never knowing. But years later, a million-to-one shot, I hear on the Farm from a guy who knew a guy who knew a guy. You know what that means? That means God wanted me to know. He fixed it so I'd hear... and then he fixed it so I'd have passage. And I'm here. God's will.

speaker: JUNE
line: What do you want with the boy?

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: He's my son. Now you're going to take me to him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, can you also check her alias, please? It's Burdett, B-u-r-d-e-t-t. …

speaker: MULDER
line: It was a live birth-- that's all you can tell me? Yeah, can you check on that, please?

speaker: TROOPER
line: This what you were looking for?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes. Thank you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: All right, thank you very much. No match on Burdett or Gurwitch.

speaker: MULDER
line: Riot slugs-- rubber. Uh-huh. … Yeah. … No. … Thank you. It's a boy. That's all I got.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sealed files?

speaker: MULDER
line: No official files. No adoption records, no records of foster care in Alabama, Mississippi, Louisiana, nothing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, maybe she didn't go through official channels. Maybe the kid's with a friend or a relative somewhere.

line: Vroom, vroom, blam!

speaker: JACKIE
line: Come on, Trevor, put your...

speaker: TREVOR
line: Blam!

speaker: JACKIE
line: Trevor, put your toys away. Dinner's almost ready. Trevor?

speaker: TREVOR
line: I'll get it.

line: No. Go wash your hands. I'll get it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Jackie, this is Agent Mulder…

speaker: JACKIE
line: June.

speaker: JUNE
line: I'm so sorry.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: You could have saved me a trip. Where is he? My boy, where is he?

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Right. I appreciate all you've done. Taking care of him. You're a good mother. Better than some, I could say.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Something smells good in here. What are you going to have?

speaker: TREVOR
line: Hi, Aunt June.

speaker: JUNE
line: Hey, baby.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: You shut up!

speaker: JUNE
line: No! No!

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Now you... you sit him back down, and you feed him his supper. It's all right. It's going to be all right. D-d-don't be upset. I ain't mad at you, buddy.

speaker: JACKIE
line: It's okay, Trevor, Mama's here, okay?

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Come on, I'm not going to hurt you. It's okay, buddy. Why don't you come over here. We'll have a man-to-man. Just have uh, a nice talk, you and me.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Uh... you're Trevor, right? Trevor Andrew. That's your name. My name is Pinker. But you can call me Pinky.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Any-anyway, uh... You and me, we're going to take a trip.

speaker: JACKIE
line: Pinker.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Shut up, please. You got some stuff you want to pack up? Some toys and stuff? Trevor...? Jackie?

speaker: JACKIE
line: Trevor, go. Go and pack some stuff, okay?

speaker: TREVOR
line: Okay.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: He's a good boy.

speaker: JACKIE
line: Trevor, run!

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Trevor! Trevor...!

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Trevor...! Trevor? Hey, buddy.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Hey, buddy. Hey, Trevor.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Hey, buddy!

line: Get him out of here, Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't make me shoot you. Don't make me shoot you.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Trevor!

line: Okay... Everything's going to be all right. We're going to get you to a safe place.

line: Let's go. Run. Run. Run. Get inside. Get inside. Get inside. Get inside.

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Give me my son! Trevor! Give me my son! Trevor! Give me my son, now!

speaker: SCULLY
line: No!

speaker: PINKER RAWLS
line: Trevor!

line: I had to do it. He would have hurt Trevor. He would... God only knows what he was thinking.

speaker: JUNE
line: What did he want?

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe another chance.
